mdRecord.dcterms:title: Outline of the geology of the globe, and of the United States in particular: with two geological maps, and sketches of characteristic American fossils / by Edward Hitchcock, D.D., LL.D., President of Amherst College, and Professor of Natural Theology and Geology
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hitchcock, Edward, 1793-1864
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "Prepared chiefly as a sequel to my Elementary geology, especially section XI"--Introductory.
Stereotyped by Hobart & Robbins, New England Type and Stereotype Foundery, Boston.
Maps have titles: Outline of the geology of the globe, 1853 -- A geological map of the United States and Canada, 1853.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 1: Imperfect: Map of the United States and Canada is not present; two copies of the "Outline of the geology of the globe, both detached, are laid in. Original blindstamped dark brown cloth. From the Cabell family library, assembled chiefly by Joseph Carrington Cabell and his nephew, Nathaniel Francis Cabell, presented to the University of Virginia by Hartwell Cabell in 1949.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 2: Both maps are present, the first detached and laid in. Original blindstamped black (?) cloth. This copy is slightly smaller than copy 1, and there are some differences in the stamping design. Battle and Battle gift.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Geology
Geology--United States.
